intro: Inula klingii, commonly known as the Tibetan Inula, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Tibet and adjacent areas of China. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Inula klingii is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions.
